availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Ball (Grant County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Grant County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Garrard County, Kentucky, native. Son of Benjamin Ball and Delitha Ball. Married to Mary Ball. Father of Allen Ball, Minerva Ball, and John Ball. Farmer in Jessamine County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Grant County in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from September 22, 1862 to May 25, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, City/District, p. 35A.
